Improving volleyballers can't stop a lashing from Leeds

In emphatic fashion and just about from the opening serve, Leeds Met Carnegie demonstrated why they top BUCS Northern Conference 2B with a display of sheer dominance against the University of York volleyball first team today...

Big freeze puts paid to Wedesday's outdoor fixtures

Yorkshire's bitter December weather has conspired to see many of Wednesday's BUCS fixtures cancelled today after pitches were deemed 'unplayable' in the frosty winter conditons...

Late drama as Langwith spoil Derwent's frisbee dreams

A last-minute point scored in the very last match by four-man Langwith forced Derwent to share first place with James in Saturday's Inter-college Frisbee tournament...

The return of college rugby: Alcuin vs. James

A gutsy fightback from James college fell short today as Alcuin made their early dominance count in the long-awaited return of college rugby...

Badminton firsts clinical in clash of table-topppers

The York men's badminton first team extended their unbeaten league run after a well-earned victory against Durham firsts on Wednesday...

Key victory against Bangor has fencing firsts back on track

York men's fencing firsts defeated a strong Bangor side yesterday to go within three points of the leaders in BUCS Northern Conference 1A...

Adam Shergold's Wednesday round-up: 26 November

Sports Editor Adam Shergold reviews the day's key BUCS action in his weekly round-up featuring YSTV's York Sport Show...

Ballers run riot in BUCS demolition job

York men's basketball firsts storm to victory against a poor Newcastle side, winning by a 34-point margin...

Second half comeback not enough for York

York men's hockey team continued their disappointing start to the season with a 3-2 loss at home to Durham thirds, meaning they remain rock bottom of the BUCS Northern Conference 2B...

Women's volleyball team edge Bradford in thriller

Victory for York in a gripping game against Bradford gave the women's volleyball team a much needed morale boost after two defeats in the BUCS League so far this season...

Success for York seniors in small boats event

The University Boat Club hosted the annual small boats competition last weekend, with consistently good performances from the entire squad on the stretch of the River Ouse between the club's Fulford boathouse and the Lowther jetty...

Easy win for men's volleyball in welcome return to form

A straight-sets victory for York against a distinctly average University of Sheffield side saw the men's volleyball team back to winning ways in BUCS today...

Lacrosse men in excellent display against league leaders

York couldn't beat a talented Sheffield side in the men's lacrosse today, but put in a very credible display nevertheless...

Women's rugby firsts frustrated by Sheffield

The UYWRUFC first team were subjected to a three-try defeat this afternoon in what was, in reality, a tight game against Sheffield Hallam firsts...

Volleyballers suffer frustrating day at England Student Cup

Captain's Analysis: Men's volleyball maestro Jack Butcher reports on a difficult day for his team at the England Student Cup last Sunday...

Cup success for York teams in whirlwind Wednesday

Several of York's sports teams are a step closer to silverware in the BUCS Cup after some spectacular displays in the second round last Wednesday.

Duo share the spoils in college run

Halifax and Vanbrugh both picked up a maximum seven points in Saturday's 4.5km college cross-country run to boost their overall standings in the college league.

TheMixer

It all boils down to the money. And for sport at York, it boils down the fact that we just don't have any.

BUCS league in focus

With the league season well underway, Nouse assesses the winners and losers of the BUCS action so far, and predicts which of York's teams will be tasting success at the end of the season

Substantial budget cuts pose threat to future of rowing club

The existence of the University Boat Club has been jeopardised following a drastic 80% reduction in budget for 2008-2009.

Minstermen let crucial lead slip against Crawley

A dubious refereeing decision in the dying moments cost managerless York City three desperately-needed Blue Square Premier points on Sunday afternoon...

Vanbrugh defeat Alcuin in spirited college netball match

A flurry of early second half goals by Vanbrugh proved enough as they overcame a determined Alcuin side in college netball yesterday...

Seconds show badminton's strength in depth

York seconds put their slow start to the season behind them, easily overcoming a sluggish Bradford first team 7-1 in the second round of the BUCS cup...

Adam Shergold's Wednesday round-up: 19 November

*<em>Update</em>* York Sport, YSTV and Nouse collaborate in Wednesday's regular York Sport show now inside Adam Shergold's weekly round-up...

Morale boosting cup win for tennis firsts

York get much needed first win of the season in the men's tennis, putting in a very solid-looking performance against Leeds seconds in the cup...

Second team knocked out of cup by Leeds in Rugby

York Rugby seconds crashed out of the BUCS Cup at the first hurdle with a 34-0 loss to a strong Leeds University seconds team...

Down but not without fight as cheerleeders stun ballers

Chester brought with them an army of cheerleaders for the BUCS Cup tie against York yesterday and it inspired their team to victory, depsite the hosts' valiant late efforts...

Magic of the cup inspires football firsts to next round

The football firsts belied their shaky league form to advance to the next round of the cup, beating Northumbria seconds 3-0 yesterday...

Football seconds thrashed in BUCS Cup

York seconds were dumped out the BUCS Cup at the second round stage following a disappointing defeat by Leeds Met thirds on the 22 Acres this afternoon...

Whitewash for netball girls in BUCS Cup second round

York first team posted a huge win against Sunderland seconds despite the game being cut short in the third quarter with the score at 55-2.
